channel.title: Nigerian Entertainment Today - Nigeria's Number 1 Entertainment Daily » News
channel.description: Nigerian Entertainment Today is Nigeria’s leading celebrity newspaper, delivering daily breaking news and juicy gossips in mobile, web, print and TV

item.title: Breaking: Tanzanian pop star, Diamond Platnumz welcomes baby girl
item.dc:creator: Adedayo Showemimo
item.description: Tanzanian singer, Diamond Platnumz and his boo, Zari Hassan have welcomed their first child together, a baby girl.
item.content:encoded:
My mom’s face it’s enough to Express how i feell😍… Welcome to the world @princess_tiffah 👼 Sura ya mama yangu inatosha kueleza ni kiasi gani najiskia ndani ya Moyo wangu😍… karibu kwenye ulimwengu @princess_tiffah

A photo posted by Chibu Dangote..😷 (@diamondplatnumz) on Aug 6, 2015 at 1:07am PDT

Tanzanian singer, Diamond Platnumz and his boo, Zari Hassan have welcomed their first child together, a baby girl.

The daughter of the MAMA Best Live Act arrived today, Thursday August 6, 2015 after days of mounting anticipation and she has been named Tiffah Dangote already.

While the baby is the first child of the ‘Nitampata Wapi’ singer, she is Zari’s 4th child.

© NET Newspapers 2015. All Rights Reserved. Please use sharing tools. Do not cut, copy or lift any content from this website without our consent.

item.title: X3M Music act, Praiz to headline 2015 Hennessy Artistry
item.dc:creator: Adedayo Showemimo
item.description: R&B singer, Praiz has been unveiled as the headliner of this year's Hennessy Artistry. The X3M music act was unveiled on August 5, 2015 by the cognac brand, making him the second R&B singer to headline the classy Hennessy Artistry.
item.content:encoded:
(‘Mercy’ singer, Praiz unveiled as the 2015 headliner of Hennessy Artistry. Photo: Filed)

R&B singer, Praiz has been unveiled as the headliner of this year’s Hennessy Artistry. The X3M music act was unveiled on August 5, 2015 by the cognac brand, making him the second R&B singer to headline the classy Hennessy Artistry.

In 2011, R&B star Banky W co-headlined the annual event alongside eLDee the Don and Tiwa Savage.

It was the turn of Starboy Entertainment boss, Wizkid and 2face Idibia last year with fans connecting to the hugely popular song from the partnership as well as the great performances across the country and beyond.

© NET Newspapers 2015. All Rights Reserved. Please use sharing tools. Do not cut, copy or lift any content from this website without our consent.

item.title: 2face and Patoranking turn up as Airtel launches Touching Lives Season 2
item.dc:creator: Hassan Sanusi
item.description: Music stars, 2face Idibia and Patoranking were present as Airtel Nigeria launched the second season of its revolutionary CSR initiative, Airtel Touching Lives on Wednesday, August 5, 2015
item.content:encoded:
2face Idibia and dancehall act, Patoranking pose with beneficiaries of Airtel Touching Lives Season 1. Photo: Airtel

Music stars, 2face Idibia and Patoranking were present as Airtel Nigeria launched the second season of its revolutionary CSR initiative, Airtel Touching Lives on Wednesday, August 5, 2015

The initiative is focused on empowering, uplifting and creating life-changing opportunities for underprivileged individuals, communities and groups in the Nigerian society and the first season ended with a huge impact.

The Season One, anchored by popular On-Air-Personality, Wana Udobang, featured 26 emotion-evoking stories in a 13 episode programme.

© NET Newspapers 2015. All Rights Reserved. Please use sharing tools. Do not cut, copy or lift any content from this website without our consent.

item.title: Star Music App’s Emerging Stars Contest: Voting ends on Thursday
item.dc:creator: Hassan Sanusi
item.description: Fans have only a few hours left to vote on the Emerging Stars Contest and make the dreams of some young Nigerian music talents come true.
item.content:encoded:
The overall winner will also collaborate with Jesse Jagz and get promotional support from Cool & Wazobia FM nationwide. Photo: Choc City

Fans have only a few hours left to vote on the Emerging Stars Contest and make the dreams of some young Nigerian music talents come true.

10 upcoming artistes made it to the final stage of Star Music’s Emerging Stars Contest and have had their songs on the app for a couple of weeks, with fans listening to these undiscovered gems and voting for their favourite among them.

Everything reaches a climax on Thursday, August 6, 2015 as voting ends, while winners will be announced on Friday, August 7, 2015. All the artistes who made it to the top 10 will get consolation prizes from Airtel while the top 3 will showcase their skills on the Star Music Trek stage.

In addition, the overall winner will also collaborate with Jesse Jagz and get promotional support from Cool & Wazobia FM nationwide.

The top 10 entries include Same (Fa Ta Si Na), Tonicode (Rap Romantic), Henry McJohn (All My Life), Harry Jazz (Eledumare), Davoiz (High Me), Dope Boyz (Famous), Mani Lapussh (Baby I Like), Tomex Da Legend (Run This Town), Tentik (Believe) and Tklassik (Rumour).

Who will be crowned winner of Emerging Stars Contest? We have less than 48 hours to find out!

Download Star Music App from Google Play store or visit music.star-nigeria.com to listen and vote for your favourite songs in the contest.

© NET Newspapers 2015. All Rights Reserved. Please use sharing tools. Do not cut, copy or lift any content from this website without our consent.

item.title: Wizkid teams up with South Africa’s Bucie on new track
item.dc:creator: Kayode Badmus
item.description: An excited Wizkid who is set to drop his 3rd studio album this month, took to his Instagram page to announce the collaboration after a studio session with the MAMA 2015 nominee for Best Female Act on Sunday, August 2.
item.content:encoded:
@bucienqwiliso came thru with the vocals!! Album sounding insane! 🔥

A video posted by Wizkid Ayo Balogun (@wizkidayo) on Aug 2, 2015 at 2:14pm PDT


Nigerian singer, Wizkid has recorded a song with talented South African singer, Bucie.

An excited Wizkid who is set to drop his 3rd studio album this month, took to his Instagram page to announce the collaboration after a studio session with the MAMA 2015 nominee for Best Female Act on Sunday, August 2.

item.title: Meet the top 10 highest-paid actors in the world
item.dc:creator: Hassan Sanusi
item.description: Forbes magazine recently released its 2015 list of world's highest-paid actors. Check out the top 10 here…
item.content:encoded:
Photo: AP/Getty Images/NET

Forbes magazine recently released its 2015 list of world’s highest-paid actors.

Check out the top 10 below…

The world’s highest paid actors according to Forbes:

1. American actor Robert Downey Jr – US$80 million

2. Hon Kong actor Jackie Chan – US$50 million

3. American actor Vin Diesel – US$47 million

4. American actor Bradley Cooper – US$41.5 million

5. American actor Adam Sandler – US$41 million

6. American actor Tom Cruise – US$40 million

7. Indian film actor Amitabh Bachchan – US$33.5 million

7. Indian film actor Salman Khan – US$33.5 million

9. Indian film actor Akshay Kumar – US$ 32.5 million

10. American actor Mark Wahlberg – US$32 million

item.title: Joy! Ahmed Musa bags brace for CSKA Moscow as wife delivers 2nd child
item.dc:creator: Kayode Badmus
item.description: Nigerian striker, Ahmed Musa was on target twice as his Russian club, CSKA Moscow sailed through to the play offs of the Champions League against Sparta Prague.
item.content:encoded:
Joy all around as Ahmed Musa scores 2 goals as wife delivers 2nd baby. Photo: ESPN

Nigerian striker, Ahmed Musa was on target twice as his Russian club, CSKA Moscow sailed through to the play offs of the Champions League against Sparta Prague.

The game, which was played on Sparta’s home ground, saw CSKA qualify on 5-4 aggregate after initially playing 2-2 at home weeks ago. Musa scored a goal in each half of the game which ended 3-2 in his team’s favour.

Earlier today, Wednesday August 5, Musa’s wife, Jemila was delivered of the couple’s 2nd baby. The couple has one other son named Ahmed Musa junior.

© NET Newspapers 2015. All Rights Reserved. Please use sharing tools. Do not cut, copy or lift any content from this website without our consent.

item.title: Veteran filmmaker, Tunde Kelani launches online TV
item.dc:creator: Kayode Badmus
item.description: Respected cinematographer, Tunde Kelani is set to launch an online TV platform on Friday, August 7, 2015.
item.content:encoded:
Tunde Kelani is set to launch an online TV channel to afford his fans access to some of his works. Photo: Filed

Respected cinematographer, Tunde Kelani is set to launch an online TV platform on Friday, August 7, 2015.

The channel, to be known as www.tundekelani.tv, will propagate the works of the veteran filmmaker which include old movies and recent projects.

In a press release, Tunde Kelani disclosed that the internet-based TV channel was inspired by the need to respond to the demands of teeming fans who are unable to get their hands on the physical copies of his works due to the activities of prowling pirates.

‘It is an attempt to respond to the yearnings of our teeming fans of rich African themed contents on the go. Distributing films or other contents physically are becoming increasingly difficult, revenues are lost on a daily basis and content owners are at the mercy of the menacing activities of pirates. I think it is just natural, expedient and sensible to take contents closer to the consumers on demand and in terms that suit all the parties involved,’ he said.

Tunde Kelani, producer of top Nigerian movies like Campus Queen, Saworeide, Dazzling Mirage, Maami, Thunderbolt and many others, revealed to NET in June this year that he had stopped releasing movies on DVD due to the activities of pirates.

© NET Newspapers 2015. All Rights Reserved. Please use sharing tools. Do not cut, copy or lift any content from this website without our consent.

item.title: Harrysong’s ‘Reggae Blues‎’ features Olamide, Iyanya, Kcee and Orezi
item.dc:creator: Kayode Badmus
item.description: Five Star Music act, Harrysong has released a new single which features an array of buzzing artistes. Titled 'Reggae Blues', the song features rapper, Olamide‎, Iyanya, Orezi and 5 Star Music lead act, Kcee‎.
item.content:encoded:
Harrysong has released a new single featuring stars like Olamide, Kcee, Iyanya and Orezi. Photo: Harrysong/Instagram

Five Star Music act, Harrysong has released a new single which features an array of buzzing artistes. Titled ‘Reggae Blues’, the song features rapper, Olamide‎, Iyanya, Orezi and 5 Star Music lead act, Kcee‎.

The star studded track is a fusion of highlife and reggae and based on partying and booze. It was produced by Doctor Amir and mastered by Zeeno Foster.

© NET Newspapers 2015. All Rights Reserved. Please use sharing tools. Do not cut, copy or lift any content from this website without our consent.

item.title: 8 months after, 2face performs with Faze again in Makurdi
item.dc:creator: Olumide Adesida
item.description: Two members of beloved but defunct R 'n' B group, Plantashun Boiz, 2face and Faze surprisingly got together to deliver a performance on stage to loud cheers and admiration from fans over the weekend.
item.content:encoded:
2face and Faze reunites at Star Trek in Makurdi. Photo: BHM

Two members of beloved but defunct R ‘n’ B group, Plantashun Boiz, 2face and Faze surprisingly got together to deliver a performance on stage to loud cheers and admiration from fans over the weekend.

‘Kolomental’ singer, Faze joined the Hypertek boss on stage and the duo thrilled the audience to some popular tunes of the former group which also had Blackface as member.

The event was the Star Music Trek which held in Makurdi, the Benue state capital and the reunion came 8 months after members of the group last performed together at the 2014 Hennessy Artistry grand finale which held at the Landmark Centre in Lagos.

The disbanded group last worked together on the 2007 reunion album, Plan B and also performed together at 2faces’s  Buckwyld and Breathless concert in 2012. In February 2015, 2face also hosted Faze to a 38th birthday party at his Rumors Night Club in Festac, Lagos which had the likes of Patoranking, Terry G and others in attendance.‎

© NET Newspapers 2015. All Rights Reserved. Please use sharing tools. Do not cut, copy or lift any content from this website without our consent.

item.title: At 25, check out Wizkid’s awards won
item.dc:creator: Kenneth Atisele
item.description: By achieving fame and fortune before turning 20, Wizkid has emerged the face of the new generation of pop stars, giving hope to a large mass of young Nigerians seeking success in the Nigerian music terrain.
item.content:encoded:
By Adedayo Odulaja and Dayo Showemimo

Wizkid won the BET Award for Best International Act: Africa back in 2012. He has many more. Photo: Filed

By achieving fame and fortune before turning 20, Wizkid has emerged the face of the new generation of pop stars, giving hope to a large mass of young Nigerians seeking success in the Nigerian music terrain.

With a huge pile of awards, Wizkid is unarguably one of the biggest acts from Africa. Check out his list of awards below…

  1. 2013 Channel O Music Video Awards – Most Gifted Video of the Year – ‘Azonto’
  2. 2013 Ghana Music Awards – African Artiste of the Year
  3. 2013 City People Entertainment Awards – Musician of the Year
  4. 2013 The Future Awards – Musician of the Year
  5. BET Awards 2012 – Best International Act: Africa
  6. Headies 2012 – Artiste of the Year, Hip Hop World Revelation of the year
  7. Nigeria Entertainment Awards – Best Album of the Year for Superstar, Best Pop/R&B Artiste of the Year
  8. 2012 MOBO Awards – Best African Act
  9. 2011 Dynamix All Youth Awards – Artiste of the Year
  10. 2011 Nigeria Entertainment Awards – Best New Act of the Year
  11. 2011 The Headies – Next Rated
  12. 2011 City People Entertainment Awards – Best New Male Artiste
  13. 2011 Dynamix All Youth Awards – Promising Artiste of the Year

2015 MAMA

2015 MOBO Awards – Best African Act

2014 Nigeria Entertainment Awards – Male Artiste of the Year

2014 NEA – Best Music Video of the Year

2014 Africa Muzik Magazine Awards – Best Male West Africa

Artiste of the Year

2014 City People Entertainment Awards – Musician of the Year & Most Popular Song of the Year.

2014 World Music Awards – World’s Best Live Act, World’s Best Male Artiste, World’s Best Song

2013 – The Headies – Best Music Video, Best Collabo

2013 NMVA – Best Afro Beat Video

2013 – MTV Europe Music Awards – Best African Act

2013 – MOBO Awards – Best African Act

2013 NEA – Best Pop/R&B Artiste of the Year

2013 MTV Europe Music Awards – Best African Act

2013 Most Gifted West African Video of the Year

2012 The Headies – Album of the Year

NEA 2012 – Hottest Single of the Year, Best Music Video of the Year,

2012 Ghana Music Awards – African Artiste of the Year

2012 NMVA Best Afro Pop Video

2012 Channel O Music Video Awards – Most Gifted Newcomer Video

2011 MTV Europe Music Awards

2011 The Headies – Best Pop Single

© NET Newspapers 2015. All Rights Reserved. Please use sharing tools. Do not cut, copy or lift any content from this website without our consent.

item.title: Nollywood actress, Kate Henshaw plays JJC’s lover in forthcoming video
item.dc:creator: Kayode Badmus
item.description: After working together on 'African Skank' which was released in 2012, JJC has again starred Nollywood actress, Kate Henshaw in the upcoming video for his new track, ‘See Us Now’.
item.content:encoded:
JJC and Kate Henshaw collaborate in a new effort 3 years after working on ‘African Skank’. Photo: JJC

After working together on ‘African Skank’ which was released in 2012, JJC has again starred Nollywood actress, Kate Henshaw in the upcoming video for his new track, ‘See Us Now’.

The two act as lovers in the video which is one of the songs off JJC’s recently released 3rd studio album, Skillz. The video is expected to be released soon. In ‘African Skank’, Kate Henshaw plays the role of a Lagos big woman in traffic who later leads the Etighi dance aspect of the video.

More photos below…

© NET Newspapers 2015. All Rights Reserved. Please use sharing tools. Do not cut, copy or lift any content from this website without our consent.

item.title: Timaya faces at least 8 years in jail
item.dc:creator: Timilehin Ajagunna
item.description: With an alleged rape case hanging over Timaya, he faces between 2 and 14 years in jail if found guilty at the end of a fair trial.
item.content:encoded:
If found guilty of the rape allegations levelled against him after a trial, Timaya faces at least 8 years in jail. Photo: Instagram

Nigerian singer, Timaya is the subject of a rape allegation. The accuser, identified as Shella B, kicked off the saga on Friday, July 24 by dedicating an Instagram account to ‘exposing’ the popular Nigerian act.

Tagged exposingtherealtimaya, Shella accused the Bayelsa State-born singer of sexually assaulting her during his time in Atlanta on July 18, 2015.

In no time, her accusations fuelled several reports, forcing Timaya to react a few hours after the matter became a trending topic on social media. Coming exactly 3 days after Timaya welcomed his second daughter, the ‘Bow Down’ singer admitted he had sex with Shella but vehemently disputed the rape claims through a statement.

The self-styled Egberi Papa 1 of Bayelsa said he noticed the first sign of trouble when he turned down Shella’s request that they tag along to his Atlanta show later that day as a couple. He added that she demanded $50k from him when he tried to play it cool with her days after.

Whatever Timaya was saying at that point made no sense to Shella, an upcoming act with a number of singles to her name. Taking advantage of the spotlight her accusation had caused, she reintroduced a song she had released several months earlier.

Shella B is yet to back down over a week after she first cried out. She announced that a case is already filed against Timaya with the police in Atlanta, daring the Dem Mama Records boss to come to the United States if indeed he is innocent.

The mother of the singer’s two children, Barbara has been calm all along since the saga began, only making a veiled reference to the matter on Sunday, July 26 by sharing a photo of her first daughter, Emma with a caption: ‘Even when the devil tries to steal my happiness your smiles sunshine makes life more beautiful…Happy Sunday ya all?’

With an alleged rape case hanging over Timaya, he faces between 2 and 14 years in jail if found guilty at the end of a fair trial. Commenting on the matter, a legal practitioner, Efe Ugboro, said the process of filing the case and investigation is almost the same expect that the US legal system is more thorough and the law is enforced on stronger terms.

Citing Sections 357 and 358 of the Nigerian criminal Code, she said ‘any offence that has to do with rape, once established, carries a jail term of between 2 and 14 years.’

Dwelling on the relevant part of the Nigerian law, she states further: ‘The Section 357 and 358 of the Criminal Code Cap “C38”, Laws of the Federation, 2004, states: ‘In plain language, a person has committed rape when he has sexual relations (carnal knowledge) with a woman against her will.’

In addition, a website, www.sexoffenderattorney.com focuses on the interpretation of the law in the United States, hinting of a jail term of nothing less than 8 years.

‘Across the United States, the average prison time for rape is between 8 and 9 years’ but it remains to be seen how the case will go in the weeks and months ahead.

© NET Newspapers 2015. All Rights Reserved. Please use sharing tools. Do not cut, copy or lift any content from this website without our consent.

item.title: SPECIAL REPORT: Wizkid – Rise and rise of 25-year-old Surulere boy
item.dc:creator: Adedayo Odulaja
item.description: By achieving fame and fortune before turning 20, Wizkid emerged the face of the new generation of pop stars, giving hope to a large mass of young Nigerians seeking success in the Nigerian music terrain.
item.content:encoded:
By Adedayo Odulaja and Dayo Showemimo

Ayodeji Ibrahim Bablogun, better known as Wizkid is today one of Nigeria’s biggest music stars. Photo: Instagram

The Merriam Webstar dictionary defines a ‘Whiz Kid’ as ‘a person who is unusually intelligent or successful especially at an early age’. This definition is the reality that defines the life and career of Nigerian music superstar, Ayodeji Ibrahim Balogun popularly called Wizkid who turned 25 on July 16, 2015.

Born and bred in Surulere, an area of Lagos he remains infinitely proud of on July 16, 1990, Wizkid has by a measure of his talent, hardwork and proper guidance, risen to prominence in the Nigerian music industry.

By achieving fame and fortune before turning 20, Wizkid emerged the face of the new generation of pop stars, giving hope to a large mass of young Nigerians seeking success in the Nigerian music terrain.

In 2010, Wizkid was clearly the next emerging star and as a result of his resounding success, it became fine for any random 17 year-old kid on the streets of Surulere, Ajegunle, Ilasamaja and elsewhere to dream of becoming a music star. It became common for every music studio you went to in the hood to claim an affiliation with the boy now widely known as the Starboy.

Wizkid in Samklef’s studio way back. Photo: Samklef

They would say: ‘He used to record here, he used to learn here, he used to sleep here.’

He inspired several young people in Surulere at the time, sending out a clear signal that anybody could dream and start from whatever position. Before Wizkid, faith in the arts and music was still not all that encouraging, especially for young people. Wizkid was a new kind of star before the likes of Davido and Lil Kesh that we have all around now. Even if they deny it, it doesn’t change the fact that he inspired hope and belief in many of the young ones who came after him.

His ‘ridiculous’ success changed the music industry as we know it today and his emergence along with former label mate, Skales remains top on the list of Banky W’s achievement in the industry. This is owing to Banky’s foresight in handpicking and grooming the young man who has gone on to become one of the best artistes from Africa in the last decade.

Anything Wizkid touched turned to gold, as any song, feature or show becomes a hit and talk of the town following his involvement. His voice became embedded in the hearts of Nigerians, as his magic was further underlined at the earth-shaking concert for his Superstar album, which left everyone in awe of how far the young lad had come in so short a time.

Family Life…

Wizkid with his father and mother, whom he is quick to praise in many songs including ‘Ojuelegba’.

Wizkid was born and bred in Surulere, a partly residential partly commercial area of Lagos. He is from a large family and the youngest of six children. In a 2012 interview with Tim Westwood, he revealed that he is a product of a polygamous home; his father has three wives.

He started singing at the age of 11, releasing a 7-track album entitled Lil in his church. He later formed a group called the Glorious Five with a couple of his friends and the group actually dropped an album before the members went their separate ways.

Wizkid’s path crossed with that of notable singer and producer, OJB Jezreel in a part of his Surulere hood and soon, he was visiting Jezreel’s Point Beats Studio in Gbaja frequently. Not exactly a studio rat but his love for music means he was almost always around the studio when he was not in school.

He notably watched 2face Idibia record the Grass 2 Grace album and Sound Sultan while the latter was recording his Jagbajantis album.

A year later, Wizkid, always eager to kick things off as far as music is concerned, started recording. He caught the attention of the industry upon featuring on M.I’s ‘Fast Money, Fast Cars’ as well as Kel’s ‘Turn by Turn’.

Following the signing of his recording deal with Banky W-led EME, Wizzy fired shots of what was to come with the song, ‘Holla at your boy’ released in 2010.

With several hits like Don’t dull,’ ‘Word up,’ ‘No lele’ and others, his debut studio album, Superstar dropped in 2011 to critical acclaim.

Controversy…

In his very eventful career till date, Wizkid has had his fair share of controversy and there are several of them in truth. Here are some of the notable ones…

On June 15, 2013, Wizkid was reportedly involved in a car crash along the Lekki-Epe Expressway in Lagos. According to an article posted on Silverbird Television’s website, he was briefly hospitalised for a minor concussion resulting from the wreck.

Wizkid uploaded a photo of his son, Boluwatife on Instagram in October 2013. Photo: Instagram

On 22 August 2011, NET reported that Wizkid had fathered his first child at 21 with an undergraduate student named Oluwanishola Ogudugu. Wizkid was silent about the story and in December 2012, he denied the baby scandal during an interview with Punch. In October 2013, Wizkid uploaded a picture of himself and his 2-year-old son, Boluwatife Balogun, on his Instagram account, confirming the story NET reported over two years earlier.

On June 19, 2013, Wizkid and his management team were invited by officers of the Nigerian Police Force for questioning. Charges of breach of contract were levelled against them by a group of Unilag students. The students claimed Wizkid agreed to perform at the UNILAG Sports Centre on May 21, 2013 but didn’t show up after receiving a total sum of N500k.

As at February 2015, in a space of 8 months, Wizkid had been involved in public spats with 4 different Nigerian acts including Davido, Skales, Saeon and Samklef. In the past, Wizkid has also had online face-offs with stars like Banky W, J Martins, Tonto Dikeh and Cyrus Da Virus.

Endorsements…

Wizkid expanded his endorsement portfolio by signing a one-year deal with MTN. Photo: MTN

In 2012, Wizkid signed a one year endorsement deal with Pepsi. On May 28, 2013, Wizkid expanded his endorsement portfolio by signing a one-year deal with MTN Nigeria. On October 23, 2013, he signed an endorsement deal with Guinness for the Guinness World of More concert. On June 23, 2015, Wizkid confirmed ditching MTN for Globacom in a deal reported to be worth over N100m in total outlay.

On June 23, 2015, Wizkid confirmed he has ported from MTN to Globacom. Photo: Instagram

The birth of Starboy Entertainment…

Wizkid floated his own label, Star Boy Entertainment in 2013. Photo: Star Boy

On March 5, 2013, Wizkid established his label imprint, Starboy Entertainment which he said is aimed at giving up-and-coming artists a platform to showcase their talent. On April 17, 2013, he signed Maleek Berry and brothers, Uzezi Oniko and Okiemute Oniko popularly known as Legendury Beatz to Starboy Entertainment. On August 20, 2013, Wizkid added a young act, L.A.X to the label.

International collaborations…

While in the US, Wizkid was seen hanging out with Celebrities like Chris Brown, Rihanna, Akon, Tyga and more. Photo: Instagram

Wizkid is currently regarded as the leader of the new school as far as Nigerian pop scene is concerned. His efforts towards taking the African sound beyond the borders of the continent has steadily yielded positive fruits in the last 2 years.

After releasing the EME compilation album, Empire Mates State of Mind, the acts under the label toured the United States of America. The tour kicked off on July 4, 2012 and ended on September 2 same year, with the stars performing in several different cities, including Houston, Dallas, Toronto, Vancouver, New York City, Providence, Calgary, Atlanta, Washington DC, and Chicago.

On an individual level, Wizkid toured London later that year, performing at the HMV Apollo and at the BBC Radio 1Xtra Live 02 Academy in Brixton alongside Trey Songz, Tulisa, Kendrick Lamar and Angel.

Wizkid was invited as a special guest for some shows in Tinie Tempah’s tour of the UK in 2014.

He also nailed a collaboration with American singer, Chris Brown on a yet-to-be-released song titled ‘African Bad Girl’ which they both performed for the first time in South Africa earlier this year during the American singer’s African Tour. His song ‘Ojuelegba,’ already considered by fans and experts as arguably his biggest ever, became a hit of international measure in July 2015 as American rapper, Drake and UK rapper, Skepta hopped on the song for a remix.

That unsolicited collaboration, like the one by Ghana’s Sarkodie on the same song, places Wizkid atop the list of international collaborations in Nigeria. When you add the collabo with Afrobeat king, Femi Kuti on ‘Jaiye Jaiye’ and several others with Jesse Jagz, Sound Sultan, Kcee and several others, there is no arguing Wizzy is the king on that lane at present.

As he continues to knock on the doors of international acclaim, much of which is made easy by his prodigious talent, it is difficult to think of what will stop Wizkid from hitting a major milestone in months and years ahead.

© NET Newspapers 2015. All Rights Reserved. Please use sharing tools. Do not cut, copy or lift any content from this website without our consent.

item.title: Yvonne Nelson named among top 50 African trailblazers
item.dc:creator: Kenneth Atisele
item.description: Ghanaian actress, Yvonne Nelson has been named one of Africa's 'Top 50 trailblazers' by The Africa Report magazine. According to the Paris-based magazine, the list contains people who are 'pioneers who will lead Africans to the Africa of tomorrow.'
item.content:encoded:
Yvonne Nelson was leader of the Dumsor protest which took place in Ghana sometime in May 2015. Photo: Instagram

Ghanaian actress, Yvonne Nelson has been named one of Africa’s ‘Top 50 trailblazers’ by The Africa Report magazine. According to the Paris-based magazine, the list contains people who are ‘pioneers who will lead Africans to the Africa of tomorrow.’

Yvonne was chosen because of her role in the Dumsor protest. ‘In a country where most celebrities avoid straddling the line between showbiz and politics, the Ghanaian actress most recently caught the attention of the public and political elite when she co-launched a protest march – with celeb colleagues Lydia Forson and Sarkodie – against the power crisis in the country.’

Other famous Africans put in the spotlight by the magazine include Ivorian football legend, Didier Drogba‎; South African politician, ‎Julius Malema and Aliko Dangote.

© NET Newspapers 2015. All Rights Reserved. Please use sharing tools. Do not cut, copy or lift any content from this website without our consent.

item.title: I stopped being a Glo ambassador 2 years ago – Monalisa Chinda
item.dc:creator: Timilehin Ajagunna
item.description: Along with Rita Dominic, Uche Jombo, Ramsey Nouah, Mike Ezuruonye, Nonso Diobi and a few others, Monalisa was dropped 2 years ago.
item.content:encoded:
Monalisa Chinda was among entertainers dropped from the list of Glo ambassadors 2 years ago. Photo: Filed

Nollywood actress and producer, Monalisa Chinda was among entertainers dropped from the list of Glo ambassadors 2 years ago.

Along with Rita Dominic, Uche Jombo, Ramsey Nouah, Mike Ezuruonye, Nonso Diobi and a few others, Monalisa was dropped 2 years ago.

When asked why she was dropped, the beautiful mother of one was very unwilling to speak to NET on the issue.

‘I don’t think we should be talking about this now. This is 2015, I stopped being a Glo ambassador in 2013, and that was two years ago,’ she snapped back without offering further details.

item.title: We’ve not been offered new Glo contract – Pasuma’s manager
item.dc:creator: Timilehin Ajagunna
item.description: Popular entertainer, Wasiu Alabi Pasuma was among entertainers introduced to the world by Glo some years ago. The prolific Fuji musician became an ambassador for the telco firm in 2010 but he is yet to get a new deal after seeing out his contract in 2013.
item.content:encoded:
Pasuma became an ambassador of Glo in 2010 but he is yet to get a new deal after his contract expired in 2013. Photo: Filed

Popular entertainer, Wasiu Alabi Pasuma was among entertainers introduced to the world by Glo some years ago. The prolific Fuji musician became an ambassador for the telco firm in 2010 but he is yet to get a new deal after seeing out his contract in 2013.

His manager, Afolabi Oyekoya told NET that they are still willing to work with the brand but are still waiting to hear from Glo as regards a new contract.

‘We haven’t been offered a new contract. We will always want to work with them whenever the opportunity arises,’ the Fuji star’s rep told NET when we sought to know the state of his engagement.

© NET Newspapers 2015. All Rights Reserved. Please use sharing tools. Do not cut, copy or lift any content from this website without our consent.

item.title: Pasuma features Olamide in new single, ‘Action’
item.dc:creator: Kayode Badmus
item.description: Fuji musician, Pasuma has released a new single off his recently unveiled hip hop album, My World. The new single, titled 'Action' features Olamide and was produced by YBNL’s Pheelz.
item.content:encoded:
Pasuma has dropped yet another single featuring Olamide. Photo: Filed

Fuji musician, Pasuma has released a new single off his recently unveiled hip hop album, My World. The new single, titled ‘Action’ features Olamide and was produced by YBNL’s Pheelz.

‘Action’ is a feel-good track which further lends credence to Pasuma’s versatility as a music act and Olamide brings his signature street lines to bear on the song.

Pasuma has earlier released singles featuring Tiwa Savage, Patoranking and Phyno while the album also features collaborations with others like Oritsefemi, Qdot and Frankie Free.

© NET Newspapers 2015. All Rights Reserved. Please use sharing tools. Do not cut, copy or lift any content from this website without our consent.

item.title: I’m happy to be back as a Glo ambassador – Odunlade Adekola
item.dc:creator: Timilehin Ajagunna
item.description: Odunlade Adekola was first signed in 2011 but the deal wasn’t renewed after the contract expired in 2013. In a chat with NET, the actor says it feels good to be back on the Glo lane.
item.content:encoded:
Popular Yoruba actor and producer, Odunlade Adekola has said it feels good to be back on the Glo lane. Photo: Instagram

Popular Yoruba actor and producer, Odunlade Adekola is happy to be back on the list of the new Glo ambassadors. The talented actor was first signed in 2011 but the deal wasn’t renewed after the contract expired in 2013.

In a chat with NET, the elated multiple-award winning actor says it feels good to be back on the Glo lane.

‘I feel so honoured. There’s no one that will be offered a good thing that won’t be happy. I am very very happy to be honest with you. I had been a Glo ambassador before now. The first time I got an endorsement deal with Glo was in 2011. I was given a two-year deal and after seeing out my contract, I was expecting a renewal but it didn’t happen until they recently called me to return.’

Speaking further, the Ogun State-based actor said: ‘That I am back as Glo ambassador shows that my contributions to the growth of entertainment industry in (the) Yoruba section and in Nigeria are being appreciated. I am very very happy to represent the brand once again.’

© NET Newspapers 2015. All Rights Reserved. Please use sharing tools. Do not cut, copy or lift any content from this website without our consent.

item.title: Dencia pays tribute to Fela, blasts Africans for ignoring anniversary of his death
item.dc:creator: Kayode Badmus
item.description: Controversial singer and businesswoman, Dencia has criticised Africans for jumping on the bandwagon when it comes to celebrating American stars and others but ignoring legends from their own setting.
item.content:encoded:
#RIP to one of the most original and influential African artists of all time.#felakuti. It’s pathetic that most Africans do not even acknowledge this day (he died 8/2/1997)but jump the bandwagon when it comes to Cecil the lion , 2pac , biggie and others (Ma toju opinion mi fun ra mi )I honored him in the #africanenergy video after learning what he stood for. He was a candid supporter of human rights and pan Africanism.The true originator of AfroBeats.He will forever remain one of Africa’s most celebrated entertainers whose voice and music stood for something and just like Late Fela,I believe in a united African republic & pan Africanism.👍🏻✊🏿👊🏼 #LetsCelebrateOurOwn

A photo posted by Dencia (@iamdencia) on Aug 2, 2015 at 9:06pm PDT

Controversial singer and businesswoman, Dencia has criticised Africans for jumping on the bandwagon when it comes to celebrating American stars and others but ignoring legends from their own setting.

The ‘African Energy’ singer hit out at Nigerians and Africans while paying tribute to late Afrobeat founder, Fela Anikulapo Kuti whose 18th death anniversary was marked over the weekend. The Cameroon-born US-based singer took to Instagram to bare her mind.

© NET Newspapers 2015. All Rights Reserved. Please use sharing tools. Do not cut, copy or lift any content from this website without our consent.
